entry.title: Reply to: Limitations of ice cores in reconstructing temperature seasonality (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Reply to: Limitations of ice cores in reconstructing temperature seasonality

  • Tyler R. Jones
  • Kurt M. Cuffey
  • Bradley R. Markle
Matters Arising01 Jan 2025

entry.title: Limitations of ice cores in reconstructing temperature seasonality (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Limitations of ice cores in reconstructing temperature seasonality

  • T. Laepple
  • T. Münch
  • M. Hörhold
Matters Arising01 Jan 2025

entry.title: GaAs nano-ridge laser diodes fully fabricated in a 300-mm CMOS pilot line (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
GaAs nano-ridge laser diodes fully fabricated in a 300-mm CMOS pilot line

A new integration approach, nano-ridge engineering, enables electrically driven GaAs-based laser diodes to be fabricated on Si wafers in a complementary metal–oxide–semiconductor (CMOS) pilot line, showing potential for the integration of laser diodes in a Si photonics platform.

  • Yannick De Koninck
  • Charles Caer
  • Joris Van Campenhout
Article01 Jan 2025

entry.title: Bone marrow niches orchestrate stem-cell hierarchy and immune tolerance (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Bone marrow niches orchestrate stem-cell hierarchy and immune tolerance

Previously undescribed hierarchical arrangements in haematopoietic stem cells and their niches that mediate both regenerative potential and immune privilege are identified.

  • Kazuhiro Furuhashi
  • Miwako Kakiuchi
  • Joji Fujisaki
Article01 Jan 2025

entry.title: Upconverting microgauges reveal intraluminal force dynamics in vivo (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Upconverting microgauges reveal intraluminal force dynamics in vivo

Nanoparticle-based ‘microgauges’ are developed for in vivo force sensing and deployed in C. elegans to investigate how mechanical force correlates with electrical signalling in neuromuscular organs.

  • Jason R. Casar
  • Claire A. McLellan
  • Jennifer A. Dionne
Article01 Jan 2025

entry.title: FBP1 controls liver cancer evolution from senescent MASH hepatocytes (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
FBP1 controls liver cancer evolution from senescent MASH hepatocytes

The p53 target FBP1 is elevated in senescent-like metabolic-dysfunction-associated steatohepatitis hepatocytes but suppressed through promoter hypermethylation and proteasomal degradation in most human hepatocellular carcinomas.

  • Li Gu
  • Yahui Zhu
  • Michael Karin
Article01 Jan 2025

entry.title: High-resolution genomic history of early medieval Europe (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
High-resolution genomic history of early medieval Europe

Twigstats, a method for ancestry reconstruction, provides high-resolution genetic histories and movement patterns of people living in Europe during the first millennium ce.

  • Leo Speidel
  • Marina Silva
  • Pontus Skoglund
ArticleOpen Access01 Jan 2025

entry.title: A collicular map for touch-guided tongue control (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
A collicular map for touch-guided tongue control

Touch-guided tongue control in mice relies on a collicular mechanosensorimotor map, analogous to collicular visuomotor maps associated with visually guided orienting across many species.

  • Brendan S. Ito
  • Yongjie Gao
  • Jesse H. Goldberg
Article01 Jan 2025

entry.title: Brain-wide cell-type-specific transcriptomic signatures of healthy ageing in mice (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Brain-wide cell-type-specific transcriptomic signatures of healthy ageing in mice

A comprehensive single-cell RNA sequencing study delineates cell-type-specific transcriptomic changes in the brain associated with normal ageing that will inform the investigation into functional changes and the interaction of ageing and disease.

  • Kelly Jin
  • Zizhen Yao
  • Hongkui Zeng
ArticleOpen Access01 Jan 2025

entry.title: Non-Abelian lattice gauge fields in photonic synthetic frequency dimensions (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Non-Abelian lattice gauge fields in photonic synthetic frequency dimensions

Non-Abelian lattice gauge fields in photonic synthetic frequency dimensions can be used to study lattice physics in a scalable and programmable way.

  • Dali Cheng
  • Kai Wang
  • Shanhui Fan
Article01 Jan 2025

entry.title: Formation of individual stripes in a mixed-dimensional cold-atom Fermi–Hubbard system (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Formation of individual stripes in a mixed-dimensional cold-atom Fermi–Hubbard system

Observations of the formation of individual stripes in a mixed-dimensional cold-atom Fermi–Hubbard quantum simulator are described, enhancing understanding of the phase diagram of high-temperature superconducting materials and the relationship between charge pairs and stripes.

  • Dominik Bourgund
  • Thomas Chalopin
  • Timon A. Hilker
ArticleOpen Access01 Jan 2025

entry.title: Monoallelic expression can govern penetrance of inborn errors of immunity (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Monoallelic expression can govern penetrance of inborn errors of immunity

Somatically determined preferential allelic expression of select genes that when mutated cause inborn errors of immunity corresponds with disease phenotypes, suggesting that the penetrance and expressivity of monogenic disorders is also dependent on the ‘transcriptotype’.

  • O’Jay Stewart
  • Conor Gruber
  • Dusan Bogunovic
Article01 Jan 2025

entry.title: Infrared nanosensors of piconewton to micronewton forces (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Infrared nanosensors of piconewton to micronewton forces

An avalanching-nanoparticle force sensor that can operate in the piconewton-to-micronewton range with exceptional force responsiveness is achieved by using the mechanical sensitivity of the photon-avalanching process.

  • Natalie Fardian-Melamed
  • Artiom Skripka
  • P. James Schuck
Article01 Jan 2025

entry.title: Dysregulation of mTOR signalling is a converging mechanism in lissencephaly (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Dysregulation of mTOR signalling is a converging mechanism in lissencephaly

Cellular, transcriptomic and proteomic analyses of organoids derived from human induced pluripotent stem cells show that mTOR pathway hypoactivation is involved in two genetically distinct lissencephaly spectrum disorders.

  • Ce Zhang
  • Dan Liang
  • Kaya Bilguvar
ArticleOpen Access01 Jan 2025

entry.title: Diversity and biogeography of the bacterial microbiome in glacier-fed streams (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Diversity and biogeography of the bacterial microbiome in glacier-fed streams

Leveraging metabarcoding and metagenomics, a survey of bacteria in the benthic microbiome across 152 glacier-fed streams (GFSs) provides a global reference for future climate-change microbiology studies on the vanishing GFS ecosystem.

  • Leïla Ezzat
  • Hannes Peter
  • Tom J. Battin
ArticleOpen Access01 Jan 2025

entry.title: Magnetospheric origin of a fast radio burst constrained using scintillation (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Magnetospheric origin of a fast radio burst constrained using scintillation

The detection of scintillation caused by inhomogeneous plasma near a fast radio burst indicates an emission process that occurs within or just beyond the magnetosphere of a compact object.

  • Kenzie Nimmo
  • Ziggy Pleunis
  • Ingrid H. Stairs
Article01 Jan 2025

entry.title: Structural diversity of axonemes across mammalian motile cilia (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Structural diversity of axonemes across mammalian motile cilia

Cryoelectron microscopy, cryoelectron tomography and proteomics are used to resolve the 96-nm modular repeat of axonemal doublet microtubules from both sperm flagella and epithelial cilia of the oviduct, brain ventricles and respiratory tract.

  • Miguel Ricardo Leung
  • Chen Sun
  • Rui Zhang
ArticleOpen Access01 Jan 2025

entry.title: Gliomagenesis mimics an injury response orchestrated by neural crest-like cells (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Gliomagenesis mimics an injury response orchestrated by neural crest-like cells

A study using glioblastoma mouse models, serial magnetic resonance imaging and single-cell profiling details changes in the identity and balance of cellular states from initiation of tumorigenesis to the end point.

  • Akram A. Hamed
  • Kui Hua
  • Peter B. Dirks
ArticleOpen Access01 Jan 2025

entry.title: Abrupt changes in biomass burning during the last glacial period (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Abrupt changes in biomass burning during the last glacial period

An increase in wildfire extent and related greenhouse gas emissions can be linked to abrupt climatic changes during the last glacial period.

  • Ben Riddell-Young
  • James Edward Lee
  • Justin Reid Clark
Article01 Jan 2025

entry.title: A pulsar-like polarization angle swing from a nearby fast radio burst (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
A pulsar-like polarization angle swing from a nearby fast radio burst

FRB 20221022A, detected by the Canadian Hydrogen Intensity Mapping Experiment Fast Radio Burst project, shows a pronounced change in polarization during the burst, providing important clues into the nature of the source.

  • Ryan Mckinven
  • Mohit Bhardwaj
  • Kendrick Smith
Article01 Jan 2025
